page.title: 01KING'S NYMPTON LANDSCAPE
page.content: This area is in the{North Devon countryside. The land is mainly farmland with some deciduous woodland. The land is used for intensive grass production, the hay and silage being used to feed cattle and sheep.The village of{King's Nympton}lies to the North West of the area and is 170 metres above sea level.It is situated on a South-facing hill. The population of the parish is approximately 350.It is a typical, small, peaceful{rural village.There are a number of attractive{thatched cob cottages. Rising above the trees may be seen the church steeple ,which is 25 metres in height. The nearest railway station, {KING'S NYMPTON,}Kis three miles away.The village is twenty seven miles north of the M5 motorway.Self- catering and 'bed and breakfast' {accommodation}is found locally.
